channel.title: Bioinformatics on Phil Chapman's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Bioinformatics on Phil Chapman's Blog

item.title: Bioinformatics Tutorials
item.description: I recorded a number of video tutorials before I left CRUK-MI on how to use various resources. These can be found on their own YouTube Channel or via the list below: Introduction to cell line data: Overview of data available and an explanation of different genomics data types and what they can be used for. Using IGV To Explore RNAseq Data: How to use the Broad Integrated Genomics Vieer to identify mutations and their consequences in RNAseq data Using the CCLE Genomics Explorer Shiny App To Identify Cell Lines : How to explore public domain cell line genomic data to identify suitable cell lines for further experimentation.
